document.docTitle: Chalcophorella (Stigmatophorella) bagdadensis subsp. quadrimaculata Frank 2020, stat.nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the subgenus Stigmatophorella of Chalcophorella (Coleoptera: Buprestidae: Chrysochroinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the subgenus Stigmatophorella of Chalcophorella (Coleoptera: Buprestidae: Chrysochroinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Stigmatophorella bagdadensis freyi : Radjabi (1976)
: 128 (catalogue).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Chalcophorella Berhauti Mandl & Pochon (1957)
: 325
(original description);
Ali (2010) : 19
(in synonymy of
C. bagdadensis bagdadensis
). syn. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type localities.
Chalcophora quadrimaculata
here specified: Schiraz [ Iran , Fars Province , Shiraz] (see ‘Remarks’);
Chalcophorella ( S. ) bagdadensis freyi
‘ Iran , Fort Sine-Sefid (Chiraz-Kazeroum)’ [ Iran , Fars Province , between Shiraz and Kazeroon];
Chalcophorella berhauti
: ‘Palmenplantage bei Sabzawaran’ [ Iran , Kermân Province , Jiroft].

Type material examined.

Redescription of lectotype .
Well preserved ♀ specimen with all appendages. Length 33.50 mm , width 13.00 mm, length/width ratio: 2.58.

Body generally black, pronotum with four pronotal principal reliefs at apical third; basal third of elytra greybronze with greenish metallic reflections around basal margin and four black elytral principal and several elytral minor reliefs.

Head black with some mouth parts brown, sparsely pubescent at lower half. Antennae serrate from antennomere IV. Scape and pedicel black, punctate and pubescent. Antennomere II ca. 2.5× shorter than I and III. Antennomeres III–XI brown, III less triangular, V–X more triangular, XI oval. Mandibles black; labrum brown, densely pubescent around border. Maxillae, labium, palpi maxillaries and palpi labiales brown, pubescent. Eyes large, oval. Frons 1.8× as wide as diameter of eye. Head impressed with medial sulcus, punctate, sparsely pubescent. Vertex finely punctate with sparse and short pubescence.

Pronotum 1.4× as wide as long, widest at mid-length, with rounded sides. Anterior margin arcuate with moderately protruding lobe, densely pubescent. Pronotal discal relief clearly bordered, black, very sparsely punctate, shiny, narrowest at apical third. Sides of pronotum grey with purple metallic reflections around pronotal discal relief, densely and finely furrowed, with pale tomentum. There are four black, shiny, irregularly circular pronotal principal reliefs at apical third, the inner are larger than the outer. Basal margin bisinuate, pronotal basal relief clearly bordered with shallow depression in the middle.
Scutellum small, black and shiny.

Elytra with several irregular shallow impressions at basal margin of each elytron. Lateral margins very slightly serrate at the apical quarter. Basal third grey-bronze with bluish metallic reflections around suture, very densely punctate to finely furrowed. There are two black, shiny, very irregularly oval elytral principal reliefs on each elytron, the outer is larger than the inner. The reliefs are joined to each other, and outer margins are merging with sculpture of elytra. There are also several black, shiny, very irregular, smaller elytral minor reliefs on each elytron. Middle and apical third black, with sparse and irregular micropunctation. Elytral impressions irregular, bronze with metallic reflections. Elytral ornaments small, bronze, tilde shaped with one (left) or two (right) inner shiny areas respectively. Epipleura horizontal, black, punctate with very sparse, short and recumbent pubescence.

Ventral side black, with bronze, metallic punctation. Majority of punctation covered by pale tomentum. Hypomeron sparsely, irregularly and coarsely punctate. Prosternum more densely punctate than hypomeron, punctures smaller than punctures on hypomeron, sparsely pubescent in punctation. Prosternal process subparallel-sided, 1.7× as long as wide, densely punctate, sides smooth and nearly impunctate. Meso- and metanepisternum black with purplish reflections, sparsely, coarsely punctate, pubescent in punctation, more densely on sides than in centre. Abdominal ventrites irregularly punctate; punctures with recumbent pubescence; on sides larger than in centre.
Legs black, moderately densely and coarsely punctate, pubescent. Tibia with two apical ventral spurs, without carinae. Tarsi black with purple reflections, pubescent.

Variation. Body ♁♁ (n = 10) length: (22.00)23.75–26.50(28.25) mm, width: 8.00– 10.50 mm , length/width ratio: 2.54–2.75; ♀♀ (n = 15): length: 26.75–35.00 mm, width: 10.25–13.75 mm , length/width ratio: 2.50–2.75. Pronotal minor reliefs exceptionally present in low amount (1–2). Aedeagus (n = 6) length: 5.68–6.64 mm , width: 1.41–1.55 mm , length/width ratio: 3.78–4.24(4.58). Penis elongate, apex of parameres roundly truncate ( Fig. 43 ).

Differential diagnosis.
Chalcophorella ( S .) bagdadensis quadrimaculata
can be distinguished from
C . ( S .) bagdadensis bagdadensis
by not clearly bordered outer elytral principal reliefs and small elytral ornaments; and from
C . ( S .) bagdadensis wandalii
by missing (or very low amount of) pronotal minor reliefs. For additional characters see Key to species.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 12–17. 12–14—
Chalcophorella ( Stigmatophorella ) bagdadensis quadrimaculata (Redtenbacher, 1850)
(lectotype, ♀ 33.50 mm). 15—
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis freyi Obenberger, 1942
(paralectotype (NMPC), ♁ 25.50 mm) =
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis quadrimaculata
. 16–17—
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis berhauti Mandl & Pochon, 1957
(holotype, ♀ 29.00 mm) =
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis quadrimaculata
. 12, 15, 16—dorsal view; 13—ventral view; 14—lateral view; 17—labels.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Biology. In the locality Iran , Khuzestan Province , 6 km SE of Azanak, [ 32°39′37′′N , 48°43′16′′E ] ( Fig. 27 ) where
C . ( S .) bagdadensis quadrimaculata
lives together with
C . ( S .) escalerae
, an imago was found on
Prunus
(sect.
Amygdalus
) arabica but in the locality there were old trees of
Pistacia khinjuk
.

In the locality Iran , Fars Province , 20 km NEE of Neyriz, 2090 m , [ 29°15′20′′N , 54°31′06′′E ] one torso of
C . ( S .) bagdadensis quadrimaculata
was found and many exit holes of this species in
Pistacia
sp. were observed. In the locality Iran , Fars Province , 20 km SE of Sarvestan, ~ 1760 m , [ 29°10′08′′N , 53°23′33–53′′E] two imagos of
C . ( S .) bagdadensis quadrimaculata
were caught in flight. In this locality there were
Pistacia
sp. and
Prunus
sp. (V. Kubáň, pers. comm. July 2020 ).
Modarres Awal (1997) mentioned ‘wild and cultivated almond’.

Chalcophorella ( S .) bagdadensis quadrimaculata
is very probably a mountain subspecies (see ‘Biology’ of
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis bagdadensis
) and it prefers
Pistacia
sp. as host plant although it can develop also in other trees.
Distribution. Iran ( Fig. 49 ).

Remarks. Redtenbacher (in Kollar & Redtenbacher, 1850 ) described
Chalcophora quadrimaculata
in ‘Über den Charakter der Insecten-Fauna von S̹dpersien [About the Character of the Insect Fauna of Southern Persia ]’ but he did not specify accurate locality in the description. ‘Schiraz [ Iran , Fars Province , Shiraz]’ is written on the locality label of lectotype ( Fig. 10 ) and also several times mentioned in introduction of this work, therefore the type locality is here specified as Shiraz, Iran , Fars Province .

I found also one male specimen in NHMW with handwritten label ‘ Kots [chy]., m S4.’ (‘m S4.’ is probably a number of locality but there are no known records about it ( H. Schillhammer , pers. comm.
February 2020
)). This species was described from material collected by Theodor Kotschy whose collection is deposited in NHMW ( Horn & Kahle, 1935 ) and the length of this specimen ( 26.50 mm ) is within the length range presented in the description 26.34–35.12 mm , therefore the specimen is designated as a paralectotype
.

Kerremans (1903) synonymized
C. quadrimaculata
with
C. stigmatica (Dalman, 1817)
without any comment and the synonymization is accepted by all following authors although it is clear also from the description that
C. quadrimaculata
belongs to subgenus
Stigmatophorella
. Therefore
C. quadrimaculata
is removed from synonymy with
C. stigmatica ,
transferred from the nominotypical subgenus to
Stigmatophorella
and downgraded to subspecies of
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis
.

Obenberger (1942) neither specified explicitly how many specimens he had at his disposal when described
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis freyi
nor measure(s) the specimen(s). He mentioned only depository ‘ Typus in coll: Frey’ . I found a male specimen in NHMB (coll. G. Frey ) which has the same locality
data as description ‘ Iran , Fort Sine-Sefid , Str. Chiraz-Kazeroun’, red label ‘Typus’ and Obenberger’s determination label ‘ Stigmatophorella bagdadensis ssp. Freyi , m. Type ,
Det. Dr Obenberger’
. Although the specimen has also label ‘ Typenbezeichnung fraglich [type designation questionable], 1956 Kamp det’ there is no reason to doubt that the specimen from NHMB is the type and it is designated as a lectotype in order to conserve the status of this taxon and avoid any further misinterpretations. I found also one male specimen in NMPC ( Fig. 15 , 43 ) with the same locality
label, red label ‘ Cotype’ and Obenberger’s determination label ‘bagdadensis ssp. Freyi , m. Cotype ,
Det. Dr. Obenberger’
( Fig. 11 ) and two female specimens in NHMB (coll. G. Frey ) with the same locality
labels. These specimens are included in the type series as paralecrotypes
.

I studied the type series of
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis freyi
and found all specimens belong to
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis quadrimaculata
. Obenberger considered
C. quadrimaculata
as aberration of
C. stigmatica
and therefore he probably did not compare it with any taxon from subgenus
Stigmatophorella
. Because there are no differences between
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis freyi
and
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis quadrimaculata
and type locality is almost identical,
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis freyi
is synonymized with
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis quadrimaculata
.

Mandl & Pochon (1957) described
C. berhauti
from one female specimen from Sabzawaran [ Iran , Jiroft] ( Figs 16, 17 ). Bílý (1981) synonymized
C. berhauti
with
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis bagdadensis
and the synonymization is accepted by all following authors. I studied the type specimen of
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis berhauti
and found the specimen belongs to
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis quadrimaculata
. Therefore
C . ( S .) bagdadensis berhauti
is removed from synonymy with
C . ( S .) bagdadensis bagdadensis
and newly synonymized with
C. ( S. ) bagdadensis quadrimaculata
.
